intro: Oenothera mollis, commonly known as the silky evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, oval seeds. Oenothera mollis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as prairies and disturbed areas. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is known for its ecological importance to pollinators.
